subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] The voices
author: Frank Sumption

 Thanks! Yeah, that's the trouble, no one but the person getting the stuff=
 seems to hear it, wiht some rare exeptptions. So how can one tell if they'=
ve really got something, of it's just a trick of the mind? That was brought=
 up o the UK site I was reading, but he guy tended to be kinda rude. 
 
 Fr=
ank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: tauferner@...: Wed, 24 O=
ct 2007 14:22:37 -0700Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The voices






Hi Frank,
 
I=
'm new to this group - as of a day! - but I have certainly listened to all =
the clips you have uploaded. I will say it's a challenge to hear exactly wh=
at you have transcribed for every file. However, I do hear some of it. Sinc=
e I don't have such an instrument and certainly not a lot of tech experienc=
e, I'm sure you're right that I'm tuning my ear to hear the usual EVPs reco=
rded with digital recorders, etc. I am curious whether, with practice, my h=
earing will become more attuned to pick out chains of words, phrases as you=
 have been able to do. Right now, I'll just hear one word or two out of a c=
lip that might have five words, for example. One thing I'm curious to know =
is whether any type of sound transmitted can be considered 'up for grabs,' =
so to say, as being an EVP? For example, in some of the EVPs I've heard on =
here as well as ones that Christopher Moon played on his Coast to Coast sho=
w back in March, some sounded like snippets of a song even. This leads me t=
o think that we who are untrained could be missing quite a bit since it cou=
ld not be the sounds we are expecting.
 
Then again, you may just have an i=
nnate sense/talent for this! I do appreciate you sharing these and I read e=
very email!
 
Take care,Lisa
----- Original Message ----From: Frank Sumptio=
n <franks-boxes@...>To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.comSent: Wednesday, Oct=
ober 24, 2007 3:57:03 PMSubject: [EVP-ITC] The voices

I think many join th=
is group expecting the old type EVP voices, like ghost hunters get. This is=
 more ITC, instrumental trans-communication . Using Electronics, or instrum=
ents, to enhance the communication, voices, and images.   I still get disco=
uraged, as most here don't seem to hear the voices, or at least never comme=
nt, it's like there's only three members, and all (3) of us don't really ne=
ed the validation of others hearing the voices. The purpose of sharing, I t=
hink, is to show what's possible, and that there is more to this than haunt=
ed houses, and whispery noises that may or may not be voices. For the most =
part it seems pretty damn useless to have a group when no one hears the stu=
ff anyway, and I've gone over and over this same theme, time and again.   I=
 think I need a break!  Frank-S
Boo! Scare away worms, viruses and so much =
more! Try Windows Live OneCare! Try now!
